availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Mary Ward. Married to Louisa Ward. Father of Robert L. Ward, Mary A. Ward, Elizabeth J. Ward, James Ward, Susan Ward, George W. Ward, and Eliza Ward. Farmer in Carter County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 257A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 918.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 249A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, District 6, p. 88B.
